revised_title: Molecular Dynamics of Hydrated Proteins: Neutron Scattering Applications
tldr: The authors conducted neutron scattering experiments on hydrated proteins, specifically deuterated phycocyanin extracted from blue-green algae. They studied the dynamics of protein hydration by analyzing the Doppler-like broadening of the quasi-elastic line at various sub-monolayer hydration levels. The results showed oscillatory behavior in the hydration structure, which was explained using a Chudley-Elliott jump diffusion model. This research provided insights into the molecular-level understanding of protein hydration and its dynamics.
